replies.bodyText:
useDebounce debounces a piece of state, meaning a second hook, likely useEffect would be needed to watch the state change and call the callback.
AppBar took a similar approach to what is currently done here with:

  
    
      openEQUELLA/Source/Plugins/Core/com.equella.core/js/tsrc/components/AppBarQuery.tsx
    
    
        Lines 72 to 74
      in
      247dde9
    
    
    
    

        
          
           const [debounceHandler] = useState(() => 
        

        
          
             debounce((value: string) => onChange(value), 500) 
        

        
          
           ); 
        
    
  


It may be good to unify the two approaches, aligning both to leverage useCallback, and/or potentially wrapping them into oEQ's own useDebounce hook.

timeline.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: Christian Murphy <christian.murphy.42@gmail.com>
Add a constant for the Escape keycode

Fix issues with memoization

The default sort order was not being maintained because
the dependency to searchOptions was not used by the callback.
This meant that for every search, the sort order was wiped and
every sort order change the search query was wiped. This commit
fixes that issue.
Make the debounce callback depend upon onChange
